alert.note: Alert for Denton; Wise (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 21 at 5:25PM CDT until March 21 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Wise County in north central Texas... Western Denton County in north central Texas... * Until 630 PM CDT. * At 525 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles north of New Fairview, or 10 miles east of Decatur, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Denton, Flower Mound, Southlake, Corinth, Trophy Club, Sanger, Decatur, Briar, Roanoke, Pecan Acres, Krum, Argyle, Justin, Double Oak, Northlake, Bartonville, Copper Canyon, New Fairview, Aurora and Boyd. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 468 and 481. Interstate 35W between mile markers 69 and 85. Interstate 35E between mile markers 461 and 466. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for north central Texas. For your protection get inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
